questions.question: The four most common elements in living organisms are...
Which of the following statements best describes a compound?

choices.answer: A compound is exemplified by sodium.
Compound contains 2 or + different elements in fixed ratio.
A compound is a pure element.

questions.question: In the equation 2H<sub>2</sub> + O<sub>2</sub> -->2H<sub>2</sub>O,

choices.answer: H<sub>2</sub>, O<sub>2</sub>, & H<sub>2</sub>O are all compounds.
H<sub>2</sub>, O<sub>2</sub>, & H<sub>2</sub>O are all elements.

questions.question: Electrons move about the nucleus of an atom in the same way that...

choices.answer: insects fly around a bright lamp at night.
cars are parked along the sides of a street.
birds migrate to a new winter home.

questions.question: If you were able to chemically analyze your stomach fluids 30 minutes after taking tablets, you

choices.answer: would find that the pH in your stomach has decreased.

questions.question: Which of the following hypotheses would be supported if liquid H2O were found on Mars?

choices.answer: Life must evolve in the presence of oxygen.
The chemical evolution of life is possible.
Life on Earth must have originated on Mars.
Life is guided by intelligent design.

questions.question: Which of the following would be considered an effective way to decrease production of acid rain

choices.answer: Discourage use of alternative energy resources.
Whenever possible, walk or ride a bike.
Building more coal-generated electricity power plants.

questions.question: A solution with a pH of 7 is...
Which of the following is dependent on ability of H2O to form hydrogen bonds with non-water?

choices.answer: the evaporative cooling of skin surfaces
milder temps of coastal regions compared to inland areas
the universality of H2O as a solvent
the ability of certain insects to walk on surface of water

questions.question: A hot drink made by dissolving instant coffee & teaspoon of sugar in hot water. Which is true?

choices.answer: Coffee & sugar dissolve >> they have no charged regions.
The water is the solute portion of the drink.

questions.question: Water's surface tension & heat storage capacity is accounted for by its...
A hydrogen atom has 1 electron. How many covalent bonds can hydrogen form?
What is the fundamental difference between covalent & ionic bonding?

choices.answer: Covalent=both partners fill shells; ionic=one does , one not
Covalent=bond btwn same element; ionic= btwn different
Covalent=outermost e<sup>-</sup> shell/ionic=next e<sup>-</sup> shell inside outer
Covalent=share e<sup>-</sup>; ionic=partner accepts e<sup>-</sup> from other

questions.question: In a water molecule, hydrogen & oxygen are held together by a(n) ___ bond.
A water molecule (H_O_H_) is held together by...
Hydrogen atoms of H2O bonded to oxygen atom by __; neighboring H2O held together by __ bonds.
Water molecules stick to other water molecules because...

choices.answer: H2O is neutral, & neutral molecules are attracted to  each
H bonds form btwn H atoms of H2O molecule & O atoms of other
covalent bonds form btwn H atoms of 1 H2O & O atoms of other
O atoms of adjacent H2O molecules are attracted

questions.question: The tendency of water molecules to stick together is referred to as...
An uncharged atom of boron has atomic number of 5 & atomic mass of 11. How many electrons?
Nitrogen atoms are composed of electrons, protons, & neutrons. An isotope of nitrogen could...

choices.answer: have more protons than the usual nitrogen atom.
have more neutrons than the usual nitrogen atom.

questions.question: What happens to an atom if the electrons in the outer shell are altered?

choices.answer: The properties of the atom will change.
Atom's characteristics change & it becomes a new element.
